meanings.definition: A specimen selected to serve as the type specimen when the original type specimen is lost or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully chose the lectotype to represent the species.
meanings.sent2: The lectotype of the butterfly was displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The lectotype decided to take a vacation from being the specimen.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the lectotype stood out like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: Children visiting the museum were fascinated by the lectotype on display.

meanings.definition: To designate a lectotype for a taxon.
meanings.sent1: The taxonomist will lectotype the new species for classification.
meanings.sent2: She lectotyped the rare plant to establish its identity.
meanings.sent3: The botanist lectotyped with such enthusiasm that it became contagious.
meanings.sent4: His ability to lectotype accurately was like a superpower in the scientific community.
meanings.sent5: The researcher lectotyped the specimen with precision and expertise.
